DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text indicator to describe whether or not a cytospin slide will be submitted to the Biospecimen Core Repository.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features._Process of using a rotating machine to generate centrifugal force to separate substances of different densities, remove moisture, or simulate gravitational effects. It employs a large motor-driven apparatus with a long arm, at the end of which human and animal subjects, biological specimens, or equipment can be revolved and rotated at various speeds to study gravitational effects. (From Websters, 10th ed; McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 4th ed)_A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A facility where things can be deposited for storage or safekeeping._The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features.:Process of using a rotating machine to generate centrifugal force to separate substances of different densities, remove moisture, or simulate gravitational effects. It employs a large motor-driven apparatus with a long arm, at the end of which human and animal subjects, biological specimens, or equipment can be revolved and rotated at various speeds to study gravitational effects. (From Websters, 10th ed; McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 4th ed):A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features.

A process where a rotating machine exposes a specimen to centrifugal force. This process can be used to remove moisture from a specimen, to subject an organism to increased gravitational forces, or to separate the components of heterogeneous mixtures based on density differences.
A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Property.preferredName: Biospecimen Repository  of Specimens and Reagents Submission
Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:A facility where things can be deposited for storage or safekeeping. :Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
A facility where items can be deposited for storage or safekeeping.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
